executive_summary: The aging population and increasingly favorable public perception of plastic surgery have driven demand for the Plastic Surgery industry over the five years to 2023. Technological advances have bolstered growth as safer and less-expensive procedures have become available to consumers. While the COVID-19 pandemic intercepted strong economic conditions that better enabled consumers to pay for plastic surgery, many consumers benefited from the injection of government stimulus into the economy, lifting per capita disposable income. The pandemic also enabled consumers with remote work routines to recover without taking time off, fueling rapid growth in 2020 and 2021.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: The COVID-19 Pandemic Produced a Unique Upswell in Demand
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The number of cosmetic surgery procedures performed in the United States has continued to grow, fueled by strong economic growth. Even as the COVID-19 pandemic ravaged the economy in 2020, many consumers benefited from the injection of government stimulus into the economy, lifting per capita disposable income in 2020 and 2021. Along with rising per capita disposable income levels, plastic surgery demand has benefited from rising total health expenditure and a growing population, expanding the industry's potential client base.

Public perceptions of cosmetic surgery have changed in recent years. With more celebrities and public figures coming forward about going under the knife, the social acceptability of cosmetic surgery has increased throughout the consumer market. A rise in cosmetic surgeries from the aging baby-boomer generation has followed, with its desire to preserve youth and health.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Elective Surgeries of All Kinds Have Grown
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Elective surgeries such as facelifts and breast implants, are typically scheduled ahead of time and are for cosmetic purposes only. These types of surgeries are heavily reliant on consumers' economic situations because they are either financed or paid for directly by the client. With more financing now available for elective cosmetic surgery, there are greater options for flexible patient-client payment programs to undertake plastic surgery.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Competition with Medical Spas has Increased
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Although profit has grown due to rising demand, an increase in competition has slowed further expansion. Practices now contended with rising competition from medical spas and clinics offering Botox injections, laser hair removal and alternative nonsurgical cosmetic procedures. Nonsurgical procedures have experienced significant growth during the past decade because the FDA approved of Botox, which temporarily reduces signs of wrinkles.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: The Rising Economic Tide Will Fuel More Spending on Cosmetic Surgery
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Plastic surgery spending will benefit from per capita disposable income growth as the economy grows. The rise in disposable income is important for this industry because many procedures performed by plastic surgeons are elective. Clients must finance the surgery or pay for it out-of-pocket. Plastic surgeons will also take advantage of growing health expenditure, which will better enable consumers to pay for nonelective procedures.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: There Will Be Opportunities in Weight Reduction Procedures
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: An increase in the number of obesity-related surgical procedures will bode well for the industry. According to the American Society for Aesthetic Plastic Surgery, two of the top five most-common surgical procedures performed by plastic surgeons are obesity-related: liposuction and abdominoplasty. Since Americans' focus on weight and dieting is not likely to change drastically, more consumers are expected to perceive these surgeries as viable options for weight loss, particularly as prices decline.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Competition From Lower-Cost Alternatives Will Remain
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The plastic surgery market will continue to face competition from medical spas and medical clinics that offer competing services will remain an issue. Nonsurgical procedures are projected to outpace more-traditional plastic surgery over the next five years. Even with plastic surgery advances, nonsurgical products' subtler and less costly changes have wide appeal. However, plastic surgeons will likely benefit from a further increase in regulation for medical spas.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Plastic Surgeons Will Continue to See Consolidation
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The number of industry enterprises is projected to grow slowly due to consolidation and the rising popularity of direct employment with hospitals. The outlook period will favor the development of large multispecialty practices primarily because of their greater leverage in negotiating payments with managed-care organizations. Merger and acquisition activity will become more prevalent to reduce overhead and increase operating efficiencies, keeping establishment growth low.

industry_definition: This industry provides medical techniques intended to enhance the physical appearance for cosmetic or reconstructive purposes. Companies consist of medical specialist clinics where licensed professional doctors perform surgical and non-surgical procedures.
key_trends: The COVID-19 pandemic provided a unique opportunity for growth.
The remote work routine necessitated by the pandemic allowed consumers to perform more invasive procedures while maintaining privacy.
Perceptions of plastic surgery have shifted, making procedures far more socially acceptable. More cosmetic surgeries among the aging baby boomer generation have followed.
Nonelective and elective procedures drive the need for plastic surgery. Increasingly, both are viewed as a necessity by individuals, limiting revenue fluctuations.
The FDA is responsible for determining the safety of medical procedures. Rulings on silicone implants, Botox and other procedures have driven trends in plastic surgery.

Nonsurgical procedures have boomed, reflecting the wider availability of treatments, decreased regulation of relevant drugs and increased affordability. Nonsurgical procedures include the injection of certain chemicals, laser treatments and chemical peels.
The COVID-19 pandemic has led to a rise in cosmetic procedures as consumers sought to take advantage of the remote work environment to complete procedures.

market_segmentation.segment_description: This age group's high demand stems from its higher disposable income than individuals in younger age groups and the fact that the physical effects of aging are more noticeable for this age group than those of younger generations.

Like patients in the 35 to 50 age group, patients between the ages of 51 to 64 have more disposable income and experience more noticeable signs of aging than those in younger age groups. However, the market is smaller than the 35 to 50 age group because of the traditional values held by some members of this cohort, in which some forms of plastic surgery are not fully embraced. Older patients also have more health risks associated with surgical procedures, which diminishes the number of procedures conducted on members of this age group.

The most popular nonsurgical procedures for the market include microdermabrasion and injectables such as Botox and Restylane. This market is the largest for breast augmentation, accounting for more than half of procedures across all age groups. Other popular surgical procedures among 19 to 34-year-olds are lipoplasty (commonly referred to as liposuction) and rhinoplasty. This market accounts for more nose-reshaping procedures than any other.

Patients 65 and older do not rely on plastic surgery because of the medical risks associated with elective procedures on older individuals, coupled with a generation not raised in a society where plastic surgery was not the norm.

The most popular surgical procedures given to patients in this market are otoplasty (cosmetic ear surgery), rhinoplasty (nose reshaping) and breast augmentation. Although the FDA recommends that breast augmentation for cosmetic purposes occur after age 18, more than half of all breast augmentations performed on women 18 and younger are cosmetic. The most popular nonsurgical procedures in this market are laser hair removal, microdermabrasion and chemical peels.

products_and_services.product_description: This product segment is perhaps best known for Botox. Botox is a brand name given to pharmaceutical maker Allergan's botulinum toxin type A strain. When injected into the skin, Botox and drugs like it blocks nerve impulses to muscles, thereby causing the muscles to relax. The relaxation causes the muscles to soften and eventually reduces the appearance of lines. Another popular injectable is Restalyne. Made by Q-Med, Restalyne and drugs like it uses hyaluronic acid to reduce the appearance of wrinkles and increase skin elasticity.

The image appears to be a pie chart or donut chart showing the percentage breakdown of different types of plastic surgeries performed. The largest slice at 21.5% represents "Other Surgeries", which likely includes a variety of procedures not specifically called out.

About one-fourth of breast augmentations use saline implants, while the rest use silicone. This is down from previous years. Depending on the policy and patient factors, insurance may cover the cost of some breast reductions. While breast augmentation or reduction is often undertaken for cosmetic purposes, some women (and men) that have undergone mastectomies.

Liposuction activity has fallen due to Americans' increasing health consciousness and willingness to tackle personal fitness through more traditional means like diet and exercise. Nevertheless, the procedure remains the second-most common surgical cosmetic procedure.

Like microdermabrasion, chemical peels seek to rejuvenate and improve the skin by removing outer layers of dead skin. Unlike abrasive techniques, these procedures achieve their results by using chemicals like alpha and beta hydroxy acids. Although a license is not required to administer such treatments, the health community recommends seeking a licensed practitioner to perform chemical peels. An anesthetic may be required depending on the chemical's strength. This product segment has remained relatively steady since it is a low-cost method of achieving observable results.

As the name implies, laser hair removal procedures use lasers to remove hair at the follicle. Similar to electrolysis, laser hair removal targets hair follicles based on their color properties relative to the surrounding skin. Like injectables, laser hair removal is a relatively new procedure that requires multiple visits. States have different laws regarding who can perform these procedures based on licensing. Like injectables, the relative novelty of laser hair removal has boosted its popularity, while the need to revisit treated areas maintains growth as new clients lined up.

Dermabrasion refers to a surgical procedure, but microdermabrasion is a noninvasive technique for buffing and polishing the skin (exfoliating) to remove scar tissue, moles and other dermal anomalies. Clients are treated on an outpatient basis, and the relatively simple nature of this treatment has led to the development of at-home microdermabrasion units. Competition from readily available products has greatly reduced this treatment's share of overall procedures.

tier_1_suppliers: Human Resources & Benefits Administration in the US
Debt Collection Agencies in the US
Diagnostic & Medical Laboratories in the US
Brand Name Pharmaceutical Manufacturing in the US
Generic Pharmaceutical Manufacturing in the US
Medical Device Manufacturing in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Many of the procedures performed by the Plastic Surgeons industry are elective. Consequently, an increase in per capita disposable income will likely boost demand for industry services. A rise in per capita disposable income presents a potential opportunity for the industry.

According to the American Society for Aesthetic Plastic Surgery, people aged 35 to 50 account for an estimated 44.0% of procedures performed by the Plastic Surgeons industry. Therefore, growth in this population segment will lead to an increase in demand for industry services.

An increase in the total amount of money spent on public and private health expenditure in the United States will boost demand for elective and nonelective surgeries performed by the Plastic Surgeons industry. Any decline in total healthcare expenditure poses a potential threat to the industry.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Number of People With Private Health Insurance
demand_determinants.determinant_description: While patients often pay out-of-pocket for plastic surgery, some private health insurers offer coverage for cosmetic procedures that are needed after accidents or as part of other necessary care. While this represents a small portion of the industry, private insurance enrollment can support demand growth.

business_locations.location_description: The Southeast lays claim to the largest number of plastic surgeons. Florida alone accounts for almost one-tenth of the national share, driven by dense populations in Miami and Orlando.

New York leads the region, followed by Pennsylvania and New Jersey. New York City plays home to one of the nation's largest plastic surgery clinics, the Long Island Plastic Surgical Group, which has seven locations across that city's vast metroplex. Affluence and an extremely dense population help drive demand in The Big Apple.

The West region includes California, with the highest concentration of industry locations in the United States. Like Florida, California has a thriving beach culture and a high concentration of affluent people willing to pay a premium to look their best. The presence of Hollywood's TV and film industries also helps drive demand for services that keep entertainment personalities looking camera-ready.

regulations_points.regulation_description: The FDA has been very hands-on with its review of silicone breast implants and their safety in patients' bodies. In 1992, silicone implants were banned from use in America, but the FDA lifted that ban in 2007 after 10 years of scientific inquiry.

Each state has specific regulations regarding the licensing and operational requirements for plastic surgeons. Each state has a medical board that issues licenses for plastic surgeons and other doctors, and sometimes these must be renewed periodically.

barriers_points.barrier_title: To perform surgical procedures, practitioners must be licensed professionals in the medical community.
barriers_points.barrier_description: To perform surgical procedures, practitioners must be licensed professionals in the medical community. Such accreditation requires years of intensive schooling, on-the-job training and a personal acumen for scientific work.

basis_points.basis_title: Plastic surgeons compete on price, service offerings, reputation and location.
basis_points.basis_description: Plastic surgeons compete on price, service offerings, reputation and location.

basis_points.basis_title: Some of the most successful practices offer various services and are considered a one-stop shop for all things related to cosmetic and plastic surgery.
basis_points.basis_description: Some of the most successful practices offer various services and are considered a one-stop shop for all things related to cosmetic and plastic surgery.

basis_points.basis_title: Competition is increasing as cosmetic services become available from other outlets.
basis_points.basis_description: Competition is increasing as cosmetic services become available from other outlets. Beauty spas and parlors offer similar services across a range of procedures.

concentration_points.concentration_description: The fragmented nature of plastic surgery is associated with additional administrative burdens on plastic surgeons. Solo practitioners must manage the planning, organizing, directing, controlling, supervising and budgeting roles of their practices.

concentration_points.concentration_title: The average establishment employs five people and generates $1.8 million in revenue.
concentration_points.concentration_description: The average establishment employs five people and generates $1.8 million in revenue.

concentration_points.concentration_title: There is Potential for Consolidation to Reduce Costs
concentration_points.concentration_description: Although the healthcare sector has undergone periods of consolidation, plastic surgeons have resisted these changes. As the industry becomes more competitive, plastic surgeons may benefit from consolidation to reduce costs and maximize efficiency.

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Purchases primarily include medical supplies, such as pharmaceutical products and Botox. It also includes the cost of objects used during other surgical procedures, such as the silicone implants that are used in breast augmentation surgery.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: To perform surgical procedures, practitioners must be licensed professionals in the medical community.
capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Such accreditation requires years of intensive schooling, on-the-job training and a personal acumen for scientific work.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: Major market segments for industry operators are relatively diversified.
capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The spread of market segments suggests that there are limited entry points other than those already served by incumbent operators.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Nonelective surgeries create a stable base of demand
volatility_points.volatility_description: Demand for nonelective surgeries, which are medically necessary, follows trends in overall healthcare spending and are typically covered by insurance providers.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Spending on elective surgeries trends toward stability
volatility_points.volatility_description: Nonelective surgeries drove an increase in the number of cosmetic surgery procedures performed in the United States in recent years. Growth in procedure frequency has been driven by the aging population, demographic trends and improved technologies.

technological_change_points.technological_change_description: This product segment is perhaps best known for Botox. Botox is a brand name given to pharmaceutical maker Allergan's botulinum toxin type A strain. When injected into the skin, Botox and drugs like it blocks nerve impulses to muscles, thereby causing the muscles to relax.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Demand for breast augmentations and reductions has remained steady
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: About one-fourth of breast augmentations use saline implants, while the rest use silicone. This is down from previous years. Depending on the policy and patient factors, insurance may cover the cost of some breast reductions.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: The need for liposuction is declining
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Liposuction activity has fallen due to Americans' increasing health consciousness and willingness to tackle personal fitness through more traditional means like diet and exercise.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Chemical peels comprise a fraction of all cosmetic procedures
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Like microdermabrasion, chemical peels seek to rejuvenate and improve the skin by removing outer layers of dead skin. Unlike abrasive techniques, these procedures achieve their results by using chemicals like alpha and beta hydroxy acids.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Laser hair removal has become increasingly popular
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: As the name implies, laser hair removal procedures use lasers to remove hair at the follicle. Similar to electrolysis, laser hair removal targets hair follicles based on their color properties relative to the surrounding skin.
Dermabrasion refers to a surgical procedure, but microdermabrasion is a noninvasive technique for buffing and polishing the skin (exfoliating) to remove scar tissue, moles and other dermal anomalies.

FAQs.question: Has increased access to health insurance offered opportunities for your company?
FAQs.answer: Demand for necessary procedures rises with increased access to health insurance.

FAQs.question: How does your company market its services to the wider community?
FAQs.answer: Plastic surgeons rely heavily on advertising, including everything from web search advertising to billboards.

FAQs.question: How can you encourage visits from individuals who lack health insurance?
FAQs.answer: Many plastic surgery procedures are elective, so clients are accustomed to paying out-of-pocket.

FAQs.question: How do you manage operating expenses to ensure maximum profitability?
FAQs.answer: Many plastic surgeons work with group purchasing organizations to limit purchase expenses.

FAQs.question: Is your company investing in new technology to improve internal processes?
FAQs.answer: Digital record systems help providers manage patient data, but are often targeted by hackers. Healthcare providers must also purchase cyber security software to limit this threat.

FAQs.question: How is your company leveraging new technology to diversify product and service offerings?
FAQs.answer: Plastic surgeons must invest in new technology to offer the latest advancements in procedures.

FAQs.question: Have any new mandates, as a result of healthcare reform, expanded your client base?
FAQs.answer: Healthcare reform has led to wider access to insurance, and therefore, demand for industry services.

FAQs.question: Have your regulatory expenses been impacted by federal healthcare reform?
FAQs.answer: As an extensive piece of legislation, healthcare reform has grown the compliance costs for many plastic surgeons.

FAQs.question: How do you keep operating costs down while still providing high levels of service?
FAQs.answer: Many plastic surgery centers use group purchasing organizations to minimize purchase costs.

FAQs.question: How frequently does your company have to replace its equipment?
FAQs.answer: Most plastic surgeons need to replace equipment relatively frequently, due to rapid technological advances throughout the sector.

FAQs.question: Do you have a strong reputation among customers? Are you known for your reliability and performance?
FAQs.answer: The best plastic surgeons are internationally renowned in their field and can attract patients from around the world.

FAQs.question: How quickly can new technology be adopted? Does your company keep up to date with the latest technology?
FAQs.answer: The federal government heavily regulates the products and services in this industry.

FAQs.question: Are you located in a densely populated area? How close are you to your nearest competitors?
FAQs.answer: Plastic surgeons often locate near hospitals or in densely populated areas.

FAQs.question: Does your company face a high level of competition?
FAQs.answer: Some services, including Botox injections and laser hair removal, are performed by medical spas and clinics that do not operate in this industry.

FAQs.question: Do you expect major changes in demand as a result of rising total health expenditure levels?
FAQs.answer: An increase in the total amount of money that is spent on public and private health expenditure in the United States will boost demand for elective and non-elective surgeries performed by the Plastic Surgeons industry.

FAQs.question: How do you stimulate demand when disposable income levels are low? Are you prepared to increase your staff when disposable income levels are high?
FAQs.answer: Many of the procedures performed by the Plastic Surgeons industry are elective.
